UNIVERSITY

BIRMINGHAM
Dear Marion:
Now, I knew you had left the Henry Ford Museum,
but for the 1ite of me .. when I wrote to you ... I
could not recall where you had moved. Pleased to
read that you are content in your new position.
STAFF
RAYMOND D. HURLBERT
GENERAL MANAGER
Appreciated all the names and addresses of those
to contact for potiental film material from Ford.
AL RENFRO
CHIEF ENGINEER
LOUIS PENEGUY
DIRECTOR
COORDINATION & INFORMATION
MRS. MADGE LAW
OFFICE MANAGER
Your inquiry for ideas on the NAEB Speakers1
Directory finds me in a quandry. It is probably the
tale of being in the forest. We have had a well-
accepted ETV operation here for 6 of the past 8 years
that Alabama has had ETV. It would not be too hard
to make suggestions on finding ETV speakers, but just
where to find the NAEB speakers brings the question to
my mind .. where do speakers talk to encourage others
to join NAEB outside of the educational broadcasting
field? If you can shed light on this, may be I can
think where to find the speakers.
Regards.
Louis Peneguy, Director,
Coordination and Information
The Nationâ€™s first ETV network telecasts simultaneously over four channels. Programming is originated by Auburn University,
the Birmingham Area Educational Television Association, the University of Alabama (which is also a NET affiliate), and CBS-TV
and NBC-TV documentary programs and educational telecourses.
